intro: Gomphichis monstruosa, commonly known as the giant false dragonhead, is a striking member of the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, spire-like stalks and large, showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. Native to the southwestern United States, it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in arid landscapes.
